meanings.def: the act of preventing somebody/something from entering a place or taking part in something
examples: exclusion (of somebody/something) (from something) He was disappointed with his exclusion from the England squad.
Exclusion of air creates a vacuum in the bottle.
to the exclusion of something Memories of the past filled her mind to the exclusion of all else.
women's continued exclusion from political life
an exclusion order to keep your partner out of your home
Don't revise a few topics to the exclusion of all others.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is not included in something
examples: Check the list of exclusions in the insurance policy.

meanings.def: the act of deciding that something is not possible
examples: the exclusion of robbery as a motive

meanings.def: a situation in which a child is banned from attending school because of bad behaviour
examples: the exclusion of disruptive students from school
Two exclusions from one school in the same week is unusual.
disciplinary measures including exclusion from school
